SECURITY Terminal signature


Terminals should sign every block they produce. This will allow Repository members to verify that a given Repository modification was made on a given device.

Terminals can be multi-user Terminals or single-user Terminals. In practice, they will be single-user Terminals - like phones or PCs. When a Terminal is created (either temporarily in-browser or permanently in a Mobile App) it gets an Owner User. The owning User signs the Terminal creation record, proving that this Terminal belongs to them.

When a Terminal makes its first entry into a Repository it attaches the signed record of its own creation (which contains its public key and is self-signed as well).

Thus in the scenario of a lost phone, as long as the date and time of the loss is known all subsequent modifications (to all Repositories) via that Phone can be easily tracked and reverted.
